original: Paṭṭhānapakaraṇa🔽Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Dukadukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (6)🔽18.8. Hetuduka, Dassanenapahātabbadukādi🔽Hetuṁ dassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu nadassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Nahetuṁ nadassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā nanahetu nanadassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa  dhamma anuloma paccanīya  hetu duka dassanena apahātabba duka ādi  hetum dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca na hetu na dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  na hetum na dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paccayā na na hetu na na dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi

original: Hetuṁ bhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu nabhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.

original: Nahetuṁ nabhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā nanahetu nabhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Hetuṁ dassanena pahātabbahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu nadassanena pahātabbahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… sahajāte pañca …pe… avigate pañca.
analyzed: na hetum na bhāvanāya pahātabbam dhammam paccayā na na hetu na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  hetum dassanena pahātabba hetukam dhammam paṭicca na hetu na dassanena pahātabba hetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe ekam pe sahajāte pañca pe avigate pañca
translated: With a non-cause that is not to be given up through vision as condition there arises a non-cause that is not to be given up through vision. (Three times.)🔽With a cause that is a condition for giving up through vision, there arises a non-cause that is not a condition for giving up through vision. (Three times.) With a cause that is a condition for giving up through development, there arises a non-cause that is not a condition for giving up through development. (Three times.)

original: Nahetuṁ nadassanena pahātabbahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nanahetu nanadassanena pahātabbahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.🔽Hetuṁ bhāvanāya pahātabbahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nahetu nabhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko
analyzed: na hetum na dassanena pahātabba hetukam dhammam paṭicca na na hetu na na dassanena pahātabba hetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā ekam pe avigate eka  hetum bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukam dhammam paṭicca na hetu na bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ
translated: With a cause that is a condition for giving up through vision, there arises a non-cause that is a condition for giving up through development. (Three times.) With a cause that is a condition for giving up through development, there arises a non-cause that is a condition for giving up through vision. (Three times.)

original: dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… sahajāte🔽pañca …pe… avigate pañca.
analyzed: dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe ekam pe sahajāte 🔽pañca pe avigate pañca
translated: With a cause that is a condition for giving up through vision, there arises a non-cause that is a condition for giving up through vision. (Three times.) With a cause that is a condition for giving up through development, there arises a non-cause that is a condition for giving up through development. (Three times.)

original: Nahetuṁ nabhāvanāya pahātabbahetukaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nanahetu nanabhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetum na bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukam dhammam paṭicca na na hetu na na bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā hetuyā ekam pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: With a condition that is not a cause and that is not to be given up by seeing, a result that is a cause and to be given up by seeing arises, by way of condition. (In brief.)
